intro: Bersama yangambiensis, commonly known as the West African wild bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of West Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a range of colors from white to pale purple. The seeds are enclosed in tough, leathery pods and are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source.
